description: A alarm notification is sent when an alarm is cleared. The cause field will indicate which alarm
is cleared.
To enable this notification, cienaCesRapsAlarmTrapState must be enabled.
By default this trap state is enabled. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress,
cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex,cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName,
and cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm.

event.Summary: R-APS alarm cleared on virtual ring $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsAlarmClearNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex i 1 CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm i 1

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the virtual ring index that is accessible to notify objects.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex

description: This object indicates the name of the virtual ring.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName

description: This object indicates the current alarm status of a virtual ring. Multiple alarms may occur at
the same time. cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended can be used to reterive all existing alarms.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm

description: A alarm notification is sent when a ring detects a Protection-Switch-Active
condition. To enable this notification, cienaCesRapsAlarmTrapState must be enabled.
By default this trap state is enabled. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex,
cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName, and cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm.

event.Summary: R-APS $v5 alarm active on virtual ring $v4

variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the virtual ring index that is accessible to notify objects.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex

description: This object indicates the name of the virtual ring.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName

description: This object indicates the current alarm status of a virtual ring. Multiple alarms may occur at
the same time. cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended can be used to reterive all existing alarms.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm

description: A alarm notification is sent when a ring detects a Provisioning-Mismatch
condition. To enable this notification, cienaCesRapsAlarmTrapState must be enabled.
By default this trap state is enabled. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex,
cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName, and cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm.

event.Summary: R-APS $v5 alarm active on virtual ring $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsAlarmProvisionMismatchNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex i 1 CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm i 3

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the virtual ring index that is accessible to notify objects.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex

description: This object indicates the name of the virtual ring.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName

description: This object indicates the current alarm status of a virtual ring. Multiple alarms may occur at
the same time. cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended can be used to reterive all existing alarms.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm

description: On a major-ring, a node is not receiving any R-APS messages on a ringlet port
for at least 3.5 consecutive long R-APS frame intervals (i.e. 3.5 * 5 = total 17.5 seconds)
while that ring port does not report any link level failures and is not administratively disabled.
On a sub-ring, a node is not receiving R-APS messages on either ringlet port for at least 3.5
consecutive long R-APS frame intervals (i.e. 3.5 * 5 = total 17.5 seconds) while that ring port
does not report any link level failures and is not administratively disabled.
To enable this notification, cienaCesRapsAlarmTrapState must be enabled.
By default this trap state is enabled. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex,
cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName, and cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm.

event.Summary: R-APS $v5 alarm active on virtual ring $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsAlarmNoRapsPduReceivedNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex i 1 CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm i 4

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex

description: This object indicates the current alarm status of a virtual ring. Multiple alarms may occur at
the same time. cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended can be used to reterive all existing alarms.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm

description: A ringlet instance that is not the RPL Owner receives no R-APS OK message while
it is transmitting R-APS RIM messages for 13 or more minutes.
To enable this notification, cienaCesRapsAlarmTrapState must be enabled.
By default this trap state is enabled. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex,
cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName, and cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarm.

event.Summary: R-APS noRplOwnerDetected alarm active on virtual ring $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsAlarmNoRplOwnerDetectedNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex i 1 CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended s E

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the virtual ring index that is accessible to notify objects.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingNotifIndex

description: This object indicates the name of the virtual ring.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingName

description: This object shows all extsting virtual ring alarms.
Bit 0: configurationMismatch
Bit 1: protectionSwitchActive
Bit 2: noRapsPduReceived
Bit 3; noRplOwnerDetected
variables.name: CIENA-CES-RAPS-MIB::cienaCesRapsVirtualRingAlarmExtended
